sentences.en: ‘Make sure that you keep the documents in a safe place,’ Otley advised him.
sentences.cn: “一定要把文件放在安全的地方。”奥特利向他建议道。

sentences.en: A family doctor will be able to advise on suitable birth control.
sentences.cn: 家庭医生能够就合适的节育措施提出建议。

sentences.en: Dietary experts can advise on the ins and outs of dieting.
sentences.cn: 饮食专家可以对日常饮食的方方面面提出建议。

sentences.en: Doctors now advise only sparing use of such creams.
sentences.cn: 现在大夫建议，这种乳霜要慎用。

sentences.en: Experienced seamen will advise you about sailing in this weather.
sentences.cn: 有经验的海员会告诉你在这种天气下的航行情况.

sentences.en: Have you moved yet? Pls advise address, phone no.
sentences.cn: 你已经搬了吗？请告知地址和电话号码。

sentences.en: He made it a useless attempt to advise her.
sentences.cn: 他认为试图劝她是无用的.

sentences.en: Herbert would surely advise her how to approach the bank.
sentences.cn: 赫伯特一定会就如何与银行接洽向她提供意见。

sentences.en: I advise you not to trust important documents to him.
sentences.cn: 我劝你不要把重要文件交给他.

sentences.en: I advise you to have no truck with that man.
sentences.cn: 我劝你别和那人打交道.

sentences.en: I would strongly advise against going out on your own.
sentences.cn: 我要极力奉劝你别单独外出。

sentences.en: I would strongly advise against it.
In case of diabetes, physicians advise against the use of sugar.
sentences.cn: 对于糖尿病患者, 医生告诫他们不要吃糖.

sentences.en: Keep us advised of (= continue to tell us about ) any new developments.
sentences.cn: 请随时告诉我们任何新的进展情况。

sentences.en: Please advise the date of shipment as soon as possible.
Please could you advise me what I should do?
sentences.cn: 能不能请您就我该做什么给点建议呢？

sentences.en: She judged it a useless attempt to advise him.
sentences.cn: 她断定,给他提建议是徒劳的.

sentences.en: She needed someone to advise her.
sentences.cn: 她需要有个人给她出主意。

sentences.en: We’ll advise you of any changes in the delivery dates.
sentences.cn: 递送日期若有变化，我们会通知你的。

words.tran_cn: （美）受教授指导选课的学生；受到建议的人
顾问；劝告者；指导教师（等于advisor）

trans.tran_cn: 劝告，建议，提供咨询，通知
trans.tran_en: to tell someone what you think they should do, especially when you know more than they do about something
to be employed to give advice on a subject about which you have special knowledge or skill

trans.tran_cn: 劝告，忠告；建议；通知，告知
trans.tran_en: to tell someone what you think they should do, especially when you know more than they do about something
